intro: Caesia eckloniana, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and often branched. Caesia eckloniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
